subtopics.title: Significance of the French Revolution
subtopics.description: The French Revolution was more important than other revolutions of its time due to France's size, power, and population.

subtopics.title: Social Revolution
subtopics.description: Various social groups participated in the revolution, including women, Sans Colotte, peasants, and the bourgeoisie, all united by the goal of freedom.

children.title: Social Groups Involved
children.description: Women, Sans Colotte, peasants, and the bourgeoisie.

subtopics.title: Radical Nature
subtopics.description: The revolution was radical, marked by the executions of the royal family and approximately 50,000 people.

children.title: Executions
children.description: Royal family and 50,000 people were executed.

subtopics.title: Universal Impact
subtopics.description: The ideas of the revolution spread throughout Europe, America, and Asia.

subtopics.title: Stages of the French Revolution
subtopics.description: The classic stages include the Constitutional Monarchy, the First French Republic, and the Napoleonic stage.
